definition: to work from morning to night (idiom)

sentences.english: Stephanie dreams of an Amelia-type marriage day and night.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬尼夙夜企盼着一段鸾凤和鸣的姻缘。

sentences.english: The absurd man says yes and his effort will henceforth be unceasing.
sentences.chinese: 荒谬的人对此必会首肯，他的努力将夙夜匪懈。

definition: to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
to give in to/to be swayed by (personal considerations etc)/Taiwan pr. [xun2]/to follow/to expose publicly/variant of 侚[xun4]/variant of 殉[xun4]
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
the current imperial dynasty/one's own court
state/country/the Gods of earth and grain
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
